properties.areaDesc: Croatan and Roanoke Sounds; Alligator River; Albemarle Sound
properties.headline: Gale Warning issued January 4 at 11:56AM EST until January 5 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City NC
properties.description:
...STRONG WINDS AND HAZARDOUS SEAS CONTINUE THROUGH SUNDAY...
...LOW WATER CONDITIONS EARLY SUNDAY MORNING ON TIDAL RIVERS...

.A strong cold front will cross the region tonight. Breezy
pre-frontal southwest winds through this afternoon become strong west
to northwest behind the front tonight into Sunday morning. These
strong winds overnight will push water to the eastern side of the
Pamlico Sound, creating low water conditions along the tidal
rivers west of the Pamlico Sound Sunday morning. Conditions
improve through the day Sunday and Sunday night.

* WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 25 kt with gusts up to 35 kt and
very rough waters expected.

* WHERE...Albemarle, Croatan, and Roanoke Sounds and the
Alligator River.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to 7 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous seas which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 AM EST SUNDAY
